meanings.definition: Tending to forgive or overlook faults
meanings.sent1: She had a remissive attitude towards his mistakes, always ready to forgive.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's remissive nature allowed students to learn from their errors without fear.
meanings.sent3: Despite his remissive behavior, he still expected improvement in the long run.
meanings.sent4: Her remissive demeanor was like a gentle breeze, calming those around her.
meanings.sent5: The remissive approach to discipline created a positive learning environment.

meanings.sent1: His remissive actions led to a series of unfortunate events.
meanings.sent2: The remissive behavior of the employee resulted in repeated mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The remissive cat knocked over the vase without a care in the world.
meanings.sent4: The remissive driver caused a minor accident due to lack of attention.
meanings.sent5: The remissive attitude towards safety regulations endangered everyone in the workplace.

meanings.definition: Capable of being forgiven or pardoned
meanings.sent1: The offense was deemed remissive and did not lead to severe consequences.
meanings.sent2: Despite the seriousness of the mistake, it was considered remissive by the authorities.
meanings.sent3: The remissive nature of the crime puzzled both the investigators and the public.
meanings.sent4: His remissive words were like a soothing balm on the wounds of the argument.
meanings.sent5: The remissive act of kindness touched the hearts of those who witnessed it.
